intro: Canthium oliganthum var. microphyllum, commonly known as the small-leaved spurge. It is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers in clusters, which are followed by three-winged fruits. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, known for its latex-producing species. The leaves are typically glandular and may exude a milky sap when damaged.
